titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Richard Mott Jones (1843-1917) was the son of Eli and Sybil Jones. He was a 1863 graduate of Haverford College. Jones served as Headmaster of the William Penn Charter School from 1875 to 1917 and as a Manager of Haverford College from 1892 to 1906. He married Annie Virginia Costello in 1873. Their daughter was Madeline Jones, who married George John Walenta.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of letters, photos, and academic regalia of Richard Mott Jones and the Jones family. Materials include: reports on missionary activities in Syria; an inscribed copy of Mitchell's Ancient Atlas belonging to Richard M. Jones; academic regalia of Richard M. Jones; letters to Eli Jones; letters to Richard C. Jones when he was at Haverford; and photos of the Walenta family.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Haverford College: George and Madeline Walenta papers and Jones family papers.
